{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2995119,"name":"mikets","username":"mikets","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mikets/{size}/4625_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-20T10:43:20.723Z","cooked":"

Did we do something wrong or did FIRST break some of the vendor libraries? We are preparing our repo for the Rapid React season starting by copying our Infinite Recharge code over. But it doesn’t compile. In particular, NavX and LaserShark gave us errors. AHRS has references to PIDSource but PIDSource was deprecated and was removed from the latest WPILib. LaserShark has references to several WPILib classes that have changed. For example, Sendable and SendableBuilder have moved to different locations, SendableBase was deprecated and removed. I did a “check for vendor library update” and it said everything was up-to-date. We had to make some hacks in order to make it compile. If it is not something we did wrong, I would like to see FIRST coordinates with the 3rd party vendors to get these fixed. BTW, does anybody know what’s the deal with CopperForge’s website that the vendor library page gives you a 404 error? It’s been like that for ages. Somebody had to give me a private link to download their library. They should fix their website link.

mikets:

Did we do something wrong

Yep! But that’s okay! Go to the link below and hit changeling under returning teams;

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

FIRST Robotics Competition Control System

Welcome to the FIRST ® Robotics Competition Control System Documentation! This site contains everything you need to know for programming a competition robot! Community translations can be found in ...

There are instructions here that will update your current project to 2022 style.

You need to do this probably every year as wpilib morphs with improvements and adjustments to the new game.

I can’t speak to LaserShark specifically, but I believe both NavX and Rev (and possibly CTRE?) changed the URL pointing to their vendordep json file, so you’ll have to update that to the new one that supports 2022 WPILib

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2022-01-20T14:11:48.043Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":140,"readers_count":139,"score":48.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":400841,"topic_slug":"3rd-party-vendor-library-compatibility-with-wpilib","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/3rd-party-vendor-library-compatibility-with-wpilib/400841/3","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2995491,"name":"mikets","username":"mikets","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mikets/{size}/4625_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-20T20:54:39.106Z","cooked":"

We did read that page and knew there are numerous breaking changes. We have fixed all the breaks in our library. The only breaks we can’t fix are the vendor libraries. Since you mentioned that page, I re-read it again, slower this time, and did find something I missed. It said PIDSource has been moved to the old command. I checked /vendordeps and found only WPILibNewCommands.json but not OldCommands. So, I installed OldCommands and it seemed to fix the PIDSource issue. However, the Lasershark issue is still there. The problem is Lasershark is referencing Sendable and SendableBuilder in wpilibj. They were moved to util.sendable. Interestingly, I found a LibCu-latest.json in c:\Users\Public\wpilib\2022\vendordeps. I compared it with my LibCu.json that I download from a private link. The difference is the URL. In LibCu-latest.json, the URL is https://copperforge.cc/dev/files/vendordeps/LibCu-latest.json but in my LibCu.json, instead of dev/files, it is files/dev. I then entered both URLs in my web browser and found that the URL in LibCu-latest.json gave me a 404 error and the one I downloaded from a private link works. It means the one in c:\User\Public\wpilib\2022\vendordeps is WRONG.

Installing OldCommandBased is very much NOT the right solution (unless you’re still using the old command framework, in which case I’d strongly urge you to switch).

Oh, I didn’t know what OldCommand is for. No, our code is not command based, so I think it’s irrelevant. If it has nothing to do with vendor libraries, I will uninstall it.

mikets:

So, I installed OldCommands and it seemed to fix the PIDSource issue.

Nope, I was wrong. OldCommands has nothing to do with PIDSource. VSCode is being weird. I had hacks to get around all the build issues. When I installed OldCommands thinking it might fix something, I removed all the hacks and VSCode compiled fine. So I thought it did fix it. But after sitting on it for a while and compiled it again, all build errors come back. So VSCode seems to have some sort of cache and if you wait long enough, it will expire! Is there a “clean build” button in VSCode? I had to put all my hacks back and now it compiles fine. In other words, AHRS and Lasershark vendor libraries are still broken. I can get around it with my hacks though.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2022-01-20T21:51:53.619Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":76,"readers_count":75,"score":25.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":400841,"topic_slug":"3rd-party-vendor-library-compatibility-with-wpilib","display_username":"mikets","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13461,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/3rd-party-vendor-library-compatibility-with-wpilib/400841/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2995533,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-20T21:55:53.092Z","cooked":"
mikets:

OldCommands has nothing to do with PIDSource.

Actually it does. We moved PIDSource to the old commands vendordep in 2022. It’s been deprecated for several years.

If they use it, what can we do?

Vendor libraries need to get updated to track the 2022 changes. There is much more than just PIDSource that changed.

Yes, but as a team, what can we do? Would FIRST work with vendors to get them updated?

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2022-01-20T22:00:07.641Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":65,"readers_count":64,"score":23.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":400841,"topic_slug":"3rd-party-vendor-library-compatibility-with-wpilib","display_username":"mikets","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13461,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/3rd-party-vendor-library-compatibility-with-wpilib/400841/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2995541,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-20T22:00:11.061Z","cooked":"

Okay, so I think there’s a few things going on here. Let’s take a methodical approach to identify and resolve them.

First question, if you run ./gradlew build (or “Build Robot Code” from the command palette), does your code build successfully or does it show errors?

If there are errors, please share them here.

If it builds successfully, then the errors you see are just vscode’s intellisense being weird, which you can usually resolve like so: REVLib 2022 jar doesn't match documentation - #4 by Thad_House

It’s up to the vendor themselves to update. You need to identify which ones aren’t updated (in your project), then research them in case their installation instructions changed (as I alluded to previously). If they’re still not updated, you would need to find an alternative product or contact the vendor to ask for an update (or whatever other assistance they can provide)

No matching variant of edu.wpi.first:native-utils:2022.7.1 was found. The consumer was configured to find a runtime of a library compatible with Java 8, packaged as a jar, and its dependencies declared externally, as well as attribute ‘org.gradle.plugin.api-version’ with value ‘7.3.3’ but:
- Variant ‘apiElements’ capability edu.wpi.first:native-utils:2022.7.1 declares a library, packaged as a jar, and its dependencies declared externally:

- Variant ‘runtimeElements’ capability edu.wpi.first:native-utils:2022.7.1 declares a runtime of a library, packaged as a jar, and its dependencies declared externally:
- Incompatible because this component declares a component compatible with Java 11 and the consumer needed a component compatible with Java 8
- Other compatible attribute:

There’s a PR to update Copperforge’s vendordep to 2022 libraries, but they haven’t reviewed or merged it yet.

github.com/Coppersource/LibCu

Fix for WPILib 2022

Coppersource:master ← Bankst:patch-1
opened 06:07AM - 09 Jan 22 UTC
Bankst
+63 -49

We also let them know on Discord a week ago that the vendordep link on LibCu Software Library - Copperforge Docs is broken. The fix is to switch “files” and “dev” in the path.

Yes, I figured out the swapping of “dev” and “file”. But more importantly, the Lasershark library has references to Sendable and SendableBuilder that have been moved from wpilibj to util.sendable. I hope they will fix it. I worked around this issue by creating empty Sendable.java and SendableBuilder.java just extending the corresponding interfaces at the correct location. That works for me.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2022-01-20T22:29:48.262Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":16,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":44,"readers_count":43,"score":18.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":400841,"topic_slug":"3rd-party-vendor-library-compatibility-with-wpilib","display_username":"mikets","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":16846,"username":"calcmogul","name":"Tyler Veness","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13461,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/3rd-party-vendor-library-compatibility-with-wpilib/400841/17","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2995560,"name":"mikets","username":"mikets","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mikets/{size}/4625_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-20T22:35:44.369Z","cooked":"

Here is their code. As you can see, it imports Sendable and SendableBuilder from wpilibj which is no longer there.
package com.cuforge.libcu;

import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.DigitalInput;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.DigitalSource;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.DutyCycle;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Sendable;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.smartdashboard.SendableBuilder;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.smartdashboard.SendableRegistry;
